title: Predictions For 2020
summary:
Key ideas
- The author (Scott) makes 100 predictions every year and scores them after a year.
- The predictions are for January 1, 2021, and range from 0–100 in likelihood.
- The predictions range from coronavirus, politics, econ and tech, SSC, etc., friends, professional, and personal.

Key learnings
- Predictions have varying chances of coming true.
- One cannot always be accurate in predictions, and it is okay to be wrong sometimes.

Key questions
- What are the chances of the Bay Area lockdown being lifted before January 1, 2021?
- Will the US have the highest official death toll of any country due to coronavirus?
- Who will win the 2020 presidential election in the US?
- Will there be a new state that leaves the EU?
- Will Scott find a new supplement to take regularly?
